sub_topic: Calculation of heat capacity of a substance
message_1: Calculate the heat capacity of 50 grams of pure water at 25°C, given that the specific heat capacity of water is 4.184 J/g°C.
message_2:
To calculate the heat capacity of 50 grams of pure water at 25°C, you can use the formula:

Heat Capacity = mass × specific heat capacity

where mass is the mass of the water (50 grams) and specific heat capacity is the specific heat capacity of water (4.184 J/g°C).

Heat Capacity = 50 g × 4.184 J/g°C = 209.2 J/°C

So, the heat capacity of 50 grams of pure water at 25°C is 209.2 J/°C.
